source.a66d7023:
from lazypredict.Supervised import LazyClassifier
from sklearn.datasets import load_breast_cancer
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

data = load_breast_cancer()
X = data.data
y= data.target

X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y,test_size=.2,random_state =SEED)

clf = LazyClassifier(verbose=0,ignore_warnings=True, custom_metric=None)
models,predictions = clf.fit(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)
models
source.d7063092:
from lazypredict.Supervised import LazyRegressor
from sklearn import datasets
from sklearn.utils import shuffle
import numpy as np

boston = datasets.load_boston()
X, y = shuffle(boston.data, boston.target, random_state=SEED)
X = X.astype(np.float32)

offset = int(X.shape[0] * 0.9)

X_train, y_train = X[:offset], y[:offset]
X_test, y_test = X[offset:], y[offset:]

reg = LazyRegressor(verbose=0, ignore_warnings=False, custom_metric=None)
models, predictions = reg.fit(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)

models
source.8539f736: Lazy Predict helps build a lot of basic models without much code and helps understand which models works better without any parameter tuning.
